name: Age-Old Cities VR
description:
Created for the Arab World Institute (Paris, France) exhibition “Age-Old Cities: A virtual journey from Palmyra to Mossul”, this immersive VR experience brings six iconic monuments back to life.

Put on your headset, and wander around a lifesize reproduction of Palmyra’s Temple of Baalshamin and Aleppo’s souk in Syria; Leptis Magna’s basilica in Libya; the Al-Nuri Mosque, the Nabi Yunus tunnels, and the Our Lady of the Hour church in Mosul, Iraq.

Be ready to live an incredible journey, walking through these revived ancient sites, feeling the majestic splendor of places that you will then consider as a global responsibility to preserve.

More infos at https://www.imarabe.org/en/exhibitions/age-old-cities
developers: In partnership with l'Institut du monde arabe and Iconem
